other_tests.findings: The liver demonstrates no focal abnormality. There is a suggestion of increased hepatic echotexture, but no definite fatty infiltration compared with the recent CT. The common bile duct is mildly prominent at approximately 6 mm, overall less dilated compared to previous measurement of 1 cm. The gallbladder appears normal without evidence of stones. The head and body of the pancreas are unremarkable, though the tail is poorly evaluated.
other_tests.changes_over_time: The common bile duct is less dilated compared to previous measurement.
